summary: mixed infections with two or more respiratory pathogens are common in children. rapid and accurate laboratory diagnostic tests are necessary to identify the causative agents. commercial multiplex real-time PCR assays have been launched for rapid diagnosis of multiple respiratory pathogens. the xTAG-RPP assay includes a single-tube reverse transcription (RT)-PCR and DNA hybridization assay. the previous RVPv2 assay has a two-tube step for RT-PCR and DNA hybridization. the new Luminex system included all the viral respiratory targets in the RVPv2 and 3 atypical respiratory bacterial targets. bioFire FA-RP assay version 1.7 detects nucleic acids of 17 respiratory viruses and 3 bacteria, including adenovirus, HCoV (OC43, NL63, 229E, HKU1), respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), hMPV, influenza A virus (H1/2009, H1 and H3), influenza B virus, parainfluenza viruses (PIV type 1 [PIV1] to PIV4), Bordetella pert thirty-five microliters of extracted nucleic acid were added to the preplated bead reagents to resuspend the reaction reagents. RT-PCR was then performed according to the NxTAG-RPP IVD assay product insert instructions. at 95°C for 30 s, followed by 50 cycles at 95°C for 10 s and 55°C for 30 s in the Roche LightCycler 96 real-time PCR system. each batch of run included one synthetic template control and one no-template control for each target. the results were compared with the in-house real-time PCR results. agreement between the FA-RP and NxTAG-RPP systems was determined by Kappa statistics with SPSS Statistics software version 22.0. NP swabs were suspended in viral transport medium and tested using both the BioFire FA-RP and Luminex NxTAG-RPP. the extraction, amplification, and detection steps take place in separate chambers of a self-contained, single-use pouch. the procedure was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions. the Luminex NxTAG-RPP assay is a CE-IVD high-throughput multiplex system. 15 first amplification cycles at 95°C for 20 s, 65°C for 60 s, and 72°C for 10 s. 24 nested amplification cycles at 95°C for 20 s, 58°C for 60 s, and 72°C for 10 s. hybridization step at 37°C for 45 min. the FA-RP and in-house real-time PCR were considered the reference standard method in this study. for adenovirus, HCoV, RSV, hMPV, influenza A viruses, influenza B viruses, PIV, rhinovirus/enterovirus, C. pneumoniae, and M. pneumoniae, direct comparisons were made. all pathogen targets except influenza virus A/H1, B. pertussis, C. pneumoniae, and L. pneumophila were detected among the specimens. all pathogen targets except influenza virus A/H1, B. pertussis, C. pneumoniae, and HBoV were detected among the clinical specimens. 6 98.0–100 88.9 51.8–99.7 100 98.7–100 Enterovirus/rhinovirus 71 6 1 206 98.6 92.5–100 97.2 94.0–99.0 92.2 83.8–97.1 99.5 97.3–100 Influenza A virus 49 0 0 235 100 92.8–100 100 98.4–100 100 92.8–100 100 98.4–100 A/H1pdm09 virus 14 0 1 98.5–100 M. pneumoniae 5 0 0 279 100 47.8–100 100 98.8–100 98.8 96.6–99.8 91.2 76.3–98.1 100 98.5–100 Total 354 50 4 4704 98.9 97.2–99.7 99.0 98.6–99.2 87.6 84.0–90.7 99.9 99.8–100 a RM, reference standard method. agreement between the two assays was observed in 98.8% of positive targets (318/322;
